question:
Charles is comparing the tracking numbers 235 and 342 to prioritize shipments. Which words make this statement true?
235 ______ 342.

Charles checks two orders, both numbered 78,901. Which words make this statement true?
78,901 ______ 78,901.

Charles has two large orders, numbered 450,789 and 450,788. Which words make this statement true?
450,789 ______ 450,788.

Charles needs to decide which order to ship first between 504,321 and 403,210. Which words make this statement true?
504,321 ______ 403,210.

Charles is comparing orders with tracking numbers 3,456,789 and 3,456,790. Which words make this statement true?
3,456,789 ______ 3,456,790.

Charles checks two packages, one numbered 76 and the other 26. Which sign makes the statement true?
76 ___ 26

Charles compares two packages with tracking numbers 657 and 647. Which sign makes the statement true?
657 ___ 647

Charles reviews two orders, 30,002 and 30,003. Which sign makes the statement true?
30,002 ____ 30,003

Charles checks two identical orders. Which sign makes the statement true?
61,598 ____61,598

Charles is sorting orders numbered 543,210 and 543,211. Which sign makes the statement true?
543,210 ____ 543,211
